The map below shows (approximate) locations of languages for which there is an Illustration in the 
Journal of the International Phonetic Association. Green markers denote Illustrations that also appear
in the Handbook of the International Phonetic Association.

Click on the pin on the map to identify the language and follow the link to the publication and recordings, where available. Languages marked with * have multiple pins.

Use text search to locate languages by name. Clicking on links at the end of the page will zoom to the language pin.

Please zoom in further if your selected language isn't immediately visible. Some language locations are in close
proximity and overlap one another in the standard view.

Please use the github [issue tracker](https://github.com/richardbeare/marijatabain/issues/) to report problems.

### Congratulations to

* the authors of [Kalasha (Bumburet variety)](https://doi.org/10.1017/S0025100319000367) winners of the 
inaugural JIPA ["Most Illustrative Illustration"](https://cup.linguistlist.org/journals/inaugural-jipa-most-illustrative-illustration-prize/) prize.

* the shortlisted illustrations - [Ambel](https://doi.org/10.1017/S0025100320000237), [Kejom (Babanki)](https://doi.org/10.1017/S0025100319000264) and [Zhushan Mandarin](https://doi.org/10.1017/S0025100320000183).
